post.excerpt: Working in the fitness industry every personal trainer, fitness instructor and membership sales advisor all talk about if they had their own gym what they would do better.
post.content:
Working in the fitness industry every personal trainer, fitness instructor and membership sales advisor all talk about if they had their own gym what they would do better. Well I was one of them. The only difference is that now myself and Tristan king have only gone and done it. So I suppose the question is what exactly does ‘doing it better’ look like for CT Barbell? Two of the most important areas are Community and Education.

Community

At CT barbell we are very lucky to be located on the Canterbury rugby club site. Most gyms are a place to go and spend an hour of your day every so often where a tired personal trainer who is only interested in helping out if they think you might sign up as a client. Or a spin instructor who’s had too much caffeine and is doing your head in. A gym should be a place where the members and staff are all part of a community, being a member of a gym should be an integrated part of your lifestyle. Not a chore that you have to convince yourself to go through. Now this all sounds great but the real question is, how do we plan to create that environment? Well…

We have a cap on how many members we take in. This allows our small staff of local professionals to get to know every one of our members. I mean really get to know them. Not the ‘What are you training today’ sort of know each other, but the ‘how are the kids, I saw you at the pub and the hows the new puppy’ really get to know each other.

A barbecue (Or England weather friendly grub option) along with the opening of the rugby club bar after a fun day of challenges every few months for members and non members alike will provide opportunities to really feel part of the gym where you are not just a ‘member.’

Rule number 1 at CT Barbell is always to say hello. Members and staff. So if you come in and someone else is chasing those gains or smashing their cardio, a smile and a wave is something that we never want to be lacking.

Education

Now this might not be something generally associated with gym membership but we’ve set ourselves a rather unusual goal. That goal is to have the most educated member base out of any gym in the UK. Now this doesn’t mean that Tristan is going to start throwing surprise tests on anatomy and physiology in the middle of a class. There are a few ways we plan to go about this. So let me share them with you.

Rather than just telling. We as coaches will do our best to explain why we are doing what we are doing.

Guest Speakers every month will be addressing members on many areas of health and fitness. From mental health to diet and the mechanics of weightlifting.

A verity of books will be available for members to checkout. Ranging from planning a gym program to assessing your injuries.

Our social media feeds aim to be saturated with helpful information for members and non members alike.

Thanks for reading our short blog. As a new business all the help we can get is hugely appreciated so thank you for reading and please feel free to like and share.
post.title: The CT Barbell way (Our ethos)
